main event: Multiple witnesses reported observing an unidentified flying object over Lodi, Ohio on September 22, 1955, which appeared to move slowly and emitted explosion-like sounds.
interesting points: The object was described as round, with a blue-gray center and bright edges, resembling a grapefruit held at arm's length., Witnesses heard faint explosions sounding like firecrackers during the sighting., A searchlight beacon from the Akron Airport was also visible at the time of the sighting., The object was observed for approximately 30 minutes and appeared to orbit at about 100 feet in altitude., Investigators concluded that the sightings could be attributed to known objects such as searchlights or aircraft, although some details remained unexplained.
sighted object: a round object with blue-gray color and bright edges
witness description: civilians, including housewives and an Air Force Captain
